subject: Re: [sugar] Smaller XO Sugar arrow cursor?
body:
Not a bad idea at all ... would be worth trying out. Might be too
dynamically distracting, or it could be a real aid.
Cheers,
Alan
-----------
At 12:47 AM 6/27/2007, Ken Ritchie wrote:
Could size be dynamic? 

For example, blooming to an enlarged "attention-getting" size
while slewing or moving rapidly, shrinking to a "precision"
size (pointer, I-beam, fist, or whatever is appropriate to hovering
context)...provided that kind of behavior isn't blocked by some patently
obvious patent ;-) 
cheers,
--ken ritchie (atlanta)

On 6/26/07, Alan Kay
<alan.kay@squeakland.org
> wrote: 

Hi Folks --
Now that we've had more experience with running things on the XO, I

feel that the default "big arrow" cursor is too big. It
really gets
in the way of many kinds of "pointing and hitting"
operations: text,
small buttons, etc.
What do you think? Could we make this cursor smaller? Could we make

its shape a little more pleasing?
Cheers,
Alan
